meanings.definition: Having a notched edge or sawlike teeth
meanings.sent1: The serrate leaves of the plant were sharp and jagged.
meanings.sent2: The serrate knife easily cut through the tough meat.
meanings.sent3: The serrate edges of the paper made it look like a tiny saw.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a serrate quality, cutting through the silence.
meanings.sent5: The serrate mountain peaks stood out against the clear sky.

meanings.sent1: He used a special tool to serrate the edges of the wood.
meanings.sent2: The chef carefully serrated the bread for the sandwich.
meanings.sent3: The barber accidentally serrated the customer's hair, giving it a unique look.
meanings.sent4: The river had serrated the rocks over time, creating a rough surface.
meanings.sent5: She decided to serrate the fabric to add a decorative touch.

meanings.definition: Having a series of sharp projections or teeth along the edge
meanings.sent1: The serrate blade of the saw cut through the wood effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: The serrate claws of the animal helped it grip onto the tree.
meanings.sent3: The serrate design on the toy dinosaur's back made it look fierce.
meanings.sent4: The serrate outline of the building gave it a unique architectural style.
meanings.sent5: The serrate edges of the key made it easy to turn in the lock.
